title: Derby’s Take: A St. Louis Fed Report Plumbs the Potency of Monetary Policy
sub_head: Many economists are probing the complexities of monetary policy to pin down how the Fed’s tightening will play out. One such study finds policy in Q4 was at its most stimulative point in decades
body:
At the end of last year, the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy was at its most stimulative point in nearly 50 years, according to new research from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis.
The paper, written by bank economist William Emmons, sought to gauge the stance of monetary policy at its fullest, taking into account the central bank’s short-term rate target, the influence of its $9 trillion balance sheet and how the economy is performing.
